embeds.title: Watcher 2
embeds.description:
Act 2 Boss

**Blasphemer's Demise** - When Watcher loses 150 more HP, apply -4 **Strength** :p_strength: to her when she next enters Divinity or plays Ragnarok.

**Relics**: Incense Burner, Teardrop Locket, Oddly Smooth Stone, Enchiridion (A19)

messages.content:
I think that the real issue with this fight is the lack of threat. It does very little damage during most of the fight, theoretically building up to a big turn with blasphemy. However, triggering blasphemers demise is just too easy, and lets you completely negate the danger of that turn. You have a lot of time to deal the 150 damage, and can also pretty freely scale up while watcher isn't doing very much on the early turns.

Maybe it shouldn't be a full -4 strength? That's really significant considering how both ragnarok and blasphemy scale. It's a bit difficult to pinpoint any single change that would fix this fight, because it's so easy right now. Funny as desyncing the incense burner is, I don't think it comes up often enough to be a real problem (I believe only snecko and hexaghost can do it). I also really like keeping the incense burner/blasphemy interaction in, which I think is a pretty cool way to show off an interesting/rare synergy you can use in the base game. I think that blasphemers demise is just too easy to trigger and is too effective at neutralizing the threatening turn in this fight. Bronze automatons hyper beam has no such built in counterplay.
I don't think that blasphemer's demise is the main issue in the fight, it's the fact that it does almost nothing for the first 5 turns
I think it is *A* problem, but not the main one
The problem it has is that it basically happens naturally. It is activated by damaging the boss, but you already were going to.
yeah
there's a good reason why the watcher 2 boss tip is "just deal damage. lots of it. 150 damage, to be precise."
There are very few strategies that work by not damaging the enemies
[[piety]] pacifist runs (no damage) I'm looking at you

messages.content: oh hey there it is thanks bot u da best

But yeah, I think the gimmick of the boss being "it hits you for less if you hit it" is problematic, since the most efficient way to fight the boss is to hit it. Your defense being helped by having a stronger offense leads to not having to interact with the boss' mechanics
I have a similar opinion with hermit 1, but it's less egregious because it is different every turn and you can choose when to attack to disable certain effects.
would reversing the gimmick help?
it hits you for less if you do NOT hit it
also hermit 1's deadly focus is supposed to be more like normal guardian's brace
that's just wrath again though
wrt to reversed gimmick
I think it would take more than that to fix the fight, but I think that could be a cool concept for a fight

yeah
only idea I got to fix watcher 2 is to make her pp watcher
I think it could probably use a rework, it's the only watcher that uses retain and it barely even does. I think if it was reworked into establishment being the gimmick it would be cool.

Retain is still very underrepresented in the watcher fights, and I don't know why.
iirc there are actual hand size limitations for the boss fights
Oh is there?
something about not being able to display too many cards
7 might be the limit?
I think keeping it below 7 would be easy enough
i had this idea for watcher 2 to make it a combo of Battle Hymn and Pressure Points
she'd get an Echo of PP every turn but would only play it under certain conditions
you could scale with Establishment and Master Reality (which would affect both the Smites and the created PPs)
I think PP would be too much, it basically forces you to meet the conditions which I dislike. It should be a choice, not forced damage that further discourages taking risks.
I think instead having an effect that does the same as master reality but is based on a condition would be cool
perhaps she has one normal PP, but mark hp loss can be blocked like Silent 1?
the damage would be blockable
so if you decide to disobey her she just scales faster
the first 2 hits wouldn't be so bad
8 and 16

and then:
24
which is bearable
32 not so much
once she gets master reality in play those PPs hit for 11 each tho 🤔
I think a more retain centric deck would be better than a power points deck, there is a ton of retain and it can also be played into with master reality. There is only 1 card that marks.
who needs anything other than pressure point minimalist deck :awaken_sans:
so like <windmill strike> and <perseverance>-centric?
